snippet: The attack on a Lebanese Army convoy took place near the town of Arsal, the scene of battles that erupted last month between the army and militants operating in Syria.
lead_paragraph: The attack on a Lebanese Army convoy took place near the town of Arsal, the scene of battles that erupted last month between the army and militants operating in Syria.
abstract: Two Lebanese Army soldiers are killed and two are wounded when their convoy is hit by roadside bomb near border with Syria; area was scene of battles between army and militants from Islamic State and the Nusra Front.

headline.main: Bomb Kills 2 Lebanese Soldiers Near Border With Syria
headline.print_headline: Lebanon: 2 Soldiers Killed Near Syria

snippet: In practice, Hezbollah and the United States are already working — separately — on a common goal: to stop the extremist Islamic State from moving into Lebanon.
lead_paragraph: In practice, Hezbollah and the United States are already working — separately — on a common goal: to stop the extremist Islamic State from moving into Lebanon.
abstract: Hezbollah and the United States are sworn enemies who insist they will never work together, but in practice they are already working--separately--on common goal of stopping extremist Islamic State from moving into Lebanon; Hezbollah is most powerful military and political player in country and shares with US an interest in stability.

headline.main: Though Adversaries on the Surface, U.S. and Hezbollah Share a Goal
headline.print_headline: Though Adversaries on the Surface, U.S. and Hezbollah Share a Goal

lead_paragraph: The United States has delivered Hellfire missiles to the Lebanese Army and will also provide it with light aircraft, including an armed Cessna, the American ambassador to Lebanon, David Hale, said Friday.
abstract: United States has delivered Hellfire missiles to Lebanese Army and will provide it with light aircraft; Lebanon is among 10 Arab states that pledged to rally behind United States against Islamic State in Iraq and Syria.

abstract: Members of Islamic State in Iraq and Syria behead Lebanese soldier Ali al-Sayyed, one of 19 captured after militants seized border town in Lebanon; militant group releases video documenting the beheading, and a second video showing nine other soldiers begging for their lives.

lead_paragraph: Israel responded to the attack with artillery fire toward two Hezbollah positions in southern Lebanon, according to the Israeli military.
abstract: Hezbollah sets off explosive device on the Israeli-controlled side of border with Lebanon, wounding two Israeli soldiers; Israel responds with artillery fire toward two Hezbollah positions in southern Lebanon; incident ends months of relative quiet along border.

headline.print_headline: Hezbollah Attack Wounds Two Israeli Soldiers

snippet: Former Prime Minister Saad Hariri, considered Lebanon’s most influential Sunni Muslim politician, returned unexpectedly to Lebanon on Friday after three years of self-imposed exile.
lead_paragraph: Former Prime Minister Saad Hariri, considered Lebanon’s most influential Sunni Muslim politician, returned unexpectedly to Lebanon on Friday after three years of self-imposed exile.
abstract: Saad Hariri, former prime minister of Lebanon who is considered country's most influential Sunni Muslim politician, returns home after three years of self-imposed exile; unexpected return is seen as bid to assert his leadership over Lebanon’s Sunni community amid growing concern that many Sunnis are being radicalized by the war in Syria.

headline.main: Lebanon: Influential Exile Returns
headline.print_headline: Lebanon: Influential Exile Returns

snippet: Daniel Drennan, now known as Daniel Ibn Zayd, rediscovered his Lebanese heritage and converted to Islam after he began seeking answers about his adoption as an infant by an American family.
lead_paragraph: Daniel Drennan, now known as Daniel Ibn Zayd, rediscovered his Lebanese heritage and converted to Islam after he began seeking answers about his adoption as an infant by an American family.
abstract: Mark Oppenheimer Beliefs column highlights interview with Daniel Drennan, born in Beirut in 1963, and adopted by New Jersey couple through a Roman Catholic orphanage; Drennan, who has returned to Beirut and converted to Islam, is an anti-adoption activist who sees adoption a way that wealthier families and wealthier parts of world absorb children of families whose poverty they had a role in causing.

headline.main: Lebanese Adoptee, Searching for His Roots, Finds Islam
headline.print_headline: Lebanese Adoptee, Searching for His Roots, Finds Islam

abstract: At least 16 insurgents from the Nusra Front, Al Qaeda's wing in Syria, are killed in an attack on Hezbollah bases in eastern Lebanon.

headline.print_headline: Al Qaeda Affiliate Battles Hezbollah in Lebanon

abstract: United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees says number of refugees from Syrian civil war has risen above three million, calling crisis 'biggest humanitarian emergency of our era;' says more than one million people have fled in last 12 months alone.

snippet: The fighting in the Lebanese town of Arsal appeared to be the worst spillover into Lebanon since the Syrian conflict began more than three years ago.
lead_paragraph: The fighting in the Lebanese town of Arsal appeared to be the worst spillover into Lebanon since the Syrian conflict began more than three years ago.
abstract: Fighting between Lebanon's armed forces and Islamist insurgents from Syria worsens in most serious spillover of Syrian civil war in Lebanese territory to date; Lebanese Army counts its casualties from three days of fighting at 14 soldiers killed, 86 wounded and 22 missing; more than 20 Islamist fighters are also believed to be among those killed, but it is impossible to determine precise numbers.

headline.main: Border Fighting Intensifies Between ISIS and Lebanon
headline.print_headline: Border Fighting Intensifies Between ISIS and Lebanon

snippet: Renewed shelling and bombing around the border town of Arsal raised new alarms about the spread of Syria’s civil war.
lead_paragraph: Renewed shelling and bombing around the border town of Arsal raised new alarms about the spread of Syria’s civil war.
abstract: Cease-fire between Syrian Islamist insurgents and Lebanese Army forces collapses almost immediately, raising new alarms about infectious spread of Syria's civil war into Lebanon; planned 24-hour break in fighting had been meant to provide window for medical workers and relief officials to extricate the wounded and provide aid for refugees around besieged town of Arsal.

headline.main: Cease-Fire Between Syrian Insurgents and Lebanese Army Ends Quickly
headline.print_headline: Cease-Fire Between Syrian Insurgents and Lebanese Army Ends Quickly

snippet: In a story Oct. 7, The Associated Press quoted the Israeli military as describing a Hezbollah blast that wounded two Israeli soldiers as a "breach of Israel's sovereignty." The story should have made clear that the attack took place in a disputed...
lead_paragraph: In a story Oct. 7, The Associated Press quoted the Israeli military as describing a Hezbollah blast that wounded two Israeli soldiers as a "breach of Israel's sovereignty." The story should have made clear that the attack took place in a disputed area, Shebaa Farms, where the borders of Israel, Lebanon and Syria meet. Israel says the enclave is part of the Golan Heights, which it captured from Syria in 1967. Lebanon and Syria say Shebaa Farms belong to Lebanon, while the United Nations says the area is part of Syria and that Damascus and Israel should negotiate its fate.

headline.main: Clarification: Israel-Lebanon Story
headline.print_headline: Clarification: Israel-Lebanon Story

snippet: Three years after the United States left Iraq, its return to the region is getting a less than enthusiastic welcome, with allies finding ways to avoid specific commitments to an expanded effort against Sunni extremists.
lead_paragraph: Three years after the United States left Iraq, its return to the region is getting a less than enthusiastic welcome, with allies finding ways to avoid specific commitments to an expanded effort against Sunni extremists.
abstract: Return of United States to Middle East three years after withdrawing from Iraq is getting a less than enthusiastic welcome among Arab nations; leading allies like Egypt, Jordan and Turkey are all finding ways to avoid specific commitments to Pres Obama's expanded effort against Islamic State in Iraq and Syria; thirteen years of chaos have deepened political and sectarian divisions and increased mistrust of US on all sides.

headline.main: Arabs Give Tepid Support to U.S. Fight Against ISIS
headline.print_headline: Arabs Give Tepid Support to U.S. Fight Against ISIS
